page.title: 18BONNET'S FARM
page.content: Sir William Strang split Rainham Lodge into 6 plots, after Lloyd George's policy of 'a cow and an acre' was passed. Mr. Bonnet's farming grandfather owned one plot from l926-32. His son took over in l932 until l970 and now Mr. Bonnet owns it. Bonnet's Farm is run by Mr. Bonnet. He owns part of the land, and rents the rest from Essex County Council. It is a market garden farm selling vegetables eg radishes, lettuces, onions, garlic, rhubarb and parsley. He sells his crops at Stratford and Upton Park Markets, and also in Nine Elms, Aldgate, Aveley and Sainsbury's in Rainham. They have their own farm shop too.
